title: Vaccine preventable diseases
author: Healthdirect Australia
description: Vaccine preventable diseases (VPDs) — such as measles, mumps — can be prevented by an immunisation program. Learn more about VPDs in Australia.
cleaned_text: Chickenpox Chickenpox is a mild and common childhood illness, but it can also occur in adults and is occasionally serious. Learn how to help ease the symptoms. [ ](/hepatitis-a) Hepatitis A Hepatitis A is an illness that causes inflmmation to your liver. Hepatitis A usually doesn't cause long-term damage like other types of hepatitis can. [ ](/hepatitis-b) Hepatitis B Hepatitis B can lead to liver damage over time. If it turns out you have hepatitis B, it is important to protect others from infection. Find out how. [ ](/human-papillomavirus-hpv-vaccine) Human papillomavirus and HPV vaccine Human papillomavirus (HPV) is a virus commonly spread through sexual contact, which can cause cervical cancer. But vaccination can prevent it. [ ](/lyssavirus-ablv) Lyssavirus (ABLV) Find out about Australian bat Lyssavirus, and learn how it can be prevented if you are bitten or scratched by a bat. [ ](/measles) Measles Measles is a highly infectious viral disease, spread through droplets in the air. Learn about symptoms and why vaccination is essential. [ ](/meningococcal-disease) Meningococcal disease Meningococcal disease is a serious infection caused by Meningococcus bacteria. It can develop quickly, and it can be fatal. Learn about the bacteria a... [ ](/mumps) Mumps Mumps is a contagious viral infection, most common in children between 5 and 15 years. These days it's rare thanks to effective immunisation. [ ](/rubella-german-measles) Rubella (German measles) Rubella (also known as German measles) is best prevented by the MMR vaccination. Learn more about its distinctive rash, other symptoms and treatments. [ ](/shingles) Shingles Shingles is a painful rash caused by the chickenpox virus. Here's how to recognise the symptoms and find the treatment that's best for you. [ ](/tetanus) Tetanus Tetanus is an infection that can be fatal. Because of vaccination, few people now get tetanus infection in Australia. Learn more about tetanus here. [ ](/tuberculosis) Tuberculosis (TB) Tuberculosis (TB) is a highly infectious disease that mostly affects the lungs. It can live in your body for years before causing symptoms. [ ](/whooping-cough) Whooping cough Whooping cough is a contagious bacterial infection and is most serious in babies. Here's how to spot the symptoms and protect infants.
